current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the expansion, intensification, and
			 coordination of the programs and activities of the National Institutes of
			 Health with respect to Tourette syndrome.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Collaborative Academic Research Efforts for Tourette Syndrome Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Collaborative Academic Research Efforts for Tourette Syndrome Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part B of title IV of the Public Health Service Act

header.#text: Programs of the National Institutes of Health relating to Tourette syndrome
Expansion, intensification, and coordination of activities with respect to Tourette syndrome

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall expand, intensify, and coordinate the
			 programs and activities of the

with respect
			 to scientific and clinical research on Tourette syndrome.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop a system to collect data on Tourette
			 syndrome, including epidemiologic information with respect to the
			 incidence, prevalence, and impact of Tourette syndrome in the United
			 States.

text.#text: In carrying out subsection (a), the

The data collection system under paragraph (1) shall provide for the collection of primary data on
			 Tourette syndrome, including related data on the various conditions known
			 to be comorbid with Tourette syndrome.

The data collection system under paragraph (1) shall provide for the collection of data on the
			 availability of medical and social services for individuals with Tourette
			 syndrome and their families and the disaggregation of such data by
			 population and geographical region.

header.#text: Collection by population and geographical region
Collaborative Research Centers for Tourette Syndrome

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall award grants and contracts to public or
			 nonprofit private entities to pay all or part of the cost of planning,
			 establishing, improving, and providing basic operating support for
			 Collaborative Research Centers for Tourette Syndrome.

text.#text: In carrying out subsection (a), the

Each center under paragraph (1) shall conduct basic and clinical research into Tourette syndrome.
			 Such research should include investigations into the cause, diagnosis,
			 early detection, prevention, control, and treatment of Tourette syndrome.
			 The research conducted by such centers, as a group, shall include research
			 in the fields of developmental neurobiology, neuroscience, genetics,
			 psychology, and pharmacology.

A center under paragraph (1) may expend amounts provided under such paragraph to carry out a
			 program to make individuals aware of opportunities to participate as
			 subjects in research conducted by the centers.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may
			 establish, provide to the subjects described in such subparagraph,
			 referrals for health and other services, and such patient care costs as
			 are required for research.

text.#text: A program under subparagraph (A) may, in accordance with such criteria as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in decisions about awarding grants and
			 contracts to applicants which meet the scientific criteria for funding
			 under this subsection.

use the facilities of a single institution; or

be formed from a consortium of cooperating institutions and patient advocacy groups in order to

A center under paragraph (1) may—

To be eligible to make facilities so available (as described in subparagraph (A)(i)) or participate
			 in such a consortium (as described in subparagraph (A)(ii)), an
			 institution or group shall meet such requirements as the

header.#text: Organization of Collaborative Research Centers for Tourette Syndrome

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for the establishment of
			 not fewer than 4 and not more than 6 centers under paragraph (1).

text.#text: Subject to the availability of appropriations, the

ensure that each of the centers established under paragraph (1) is located in a different region of
			 the United States than the other such centers; and

encourage the formation of such centers from a consortium of entities (as described in paragraph
			 (4)(A)(ii)) covering multiple regions or States.

text.#text:
Support for a center established under paragraph (1) may be provided under this section for a
			 period of not to exceed 5 years. Such period may be extended for one or
			 more additional periods not exceeding 5 years if the operations of such
			 center have been reviewed and approved by an appropriate technical and
			 scientific peer review group established by the

header.#text: Number of centers; duration of support

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall award grants on a competitive, peer-reviewed
			 basis for research on—

text.#text: In carrying out subsection (a), the
the full range of symptomology within the Tourette syndrome clinical spectrum; and
the efficacy of treatment options for particular patient subpopulations.
